posts.name: Kasper
posts.cooked:
Code (GitHub) is Here!!

My team is currently working on making our autos smart. We use PathPlanner as our pathing tool and are creating autos with our named commands that work in tele… except our Aim command.

In this command the goal is to set our heading to the speaker (red or blue depending on what side we are) and move our wrist accordingly. This all works beautifully in tele-op but we can’t get our aim to work.

We call our path in PathPlanner then after that our aim then fire (sequentially) We have also used event markers to try to put our commands in that way. We have also tried making the path and Aim in a parallel group.

The Aim command makes the wrist adjustment okay but it doesn’t really change the heading at all. I’m just trying to figure out how to get this to work. Because if we could get this working it would be awesome for not only us, but our alliance partners.

link_counts.title: GitHub - Team319/frc319-2024: 319's 2024 Robot Code started from a Swerve template made from 6328's AdvantageKit_SwerveDriveProject

posts.cooked: We were also looking into this and I think the thing you’re missing is rotation override. I had a quick look so I could be wrong. Here’s the doc: Override Target Rotation | PathPlanner Docs . It would make sense that this is your issue considering that the rotation didn’t change at all.

posts.name: Bodi
posts.cooked: You have to override rotation in order for your auto-aim command to have any affect. It’s not a difficult process, and the pathplanner docs explain it really well.

posts.name: Abu
posts.cooked: If you haven’t already, you can split up your aim command into a command to adjust the angle and a Rotation2d to rotate to the correct heading. For the heading, as mentioned by others, override the target rotation with your Rotation2d. As for the angle adjustment, create a parallel command group within an auto that contains your adjusting angle command and a sequential group for the rest of your auto, or call the adjust angle command before you shoot.

posts.name: Steve
posts.cooked: What if someone moved a note a little bit and changing rotations isn’t good enough to collect it? Is there a way to override target Y position or something?

posts.name: Kasper
posts.cooked: Would this work for AprilTags as well? We aren’t finding the note we are using april tags

posts.name: Adithya Anand
posts.cooked: We use the path planner rotation override for aligning to the speaker using the apriltag. It should work just fine. It just depends on how you find the angle required, either the tx value from the limelight will work, or the angle calculated from the pose estimator, which is what we currently do.

As long as the method returns an optional of a rotation2d (the rotation you want the robot to have) or an empty optional, then this will work. You should be able to replace the Optional.of(Limelight…) with Optional.of( a rotation2d you got from the aim method ). I would recommend you write a check like the one in the example docs to see if the aim command returned a rotation2d, so if it doesn’t, you return an Optional.empty and the path will continue with the preprogrammed rotation.

posts.cooked:

Where it is supposed to be in my Drive.java subsystem.
I can’t see anything wrong here. Can you try putting some print statements in to see which parts of the code its reaching? Its sounds like its returning an empty optional if nothing is happening
